title: Veigar's Stun Can Have a Delay but...
body:
If it has a delay, its cast time needs to go away.

Currently it has a ~~.5~~.25 second casting time. This is a cast time that veigar players have learned to work around. It's the same with his w. His w fall time isn't actually that long, but from cast confirmation to fall, it is extremely long. From cast confirmation to the 0 damage stun, it's a full 1 second.

Now, this isn't difficult to fix. Just remove the cast time entirely so he can cast it on the move and the cast time isn't added to the delay and instead of veigar's changes being an across the board nerf, you can actually claim you gave him something.

EDIT 3-3-15: ALRIGHT, Riot, when are you going to admit you made an absolutely massive mistake on this one? Veigar is down just above 40% win rate and is falling by the day. But yeah, these nerfs made so much sense on a rarely played immobile character who was sitting just under 50% win rate. Please revert until you can at least think of a better set of changes that aren't a straight up nerf.

Edit 3-4: VICTORY
Veigar's E now stops dashes cold and the particle effects pop up at the beginning of his cast animation. Also fixed the cast times. Shorter than I thought, but still hurts him currently.

We did it boys and girls. I luff you all ^___^

People just refuse to acknowledge anything that isn't dodge-the-skillshot as counterplay so they whined and now Veigar is useless.

I never used the word counterplay in my statement. I said it was a *frustrating* aspect of his kit, not one without counterplay. Veigar has numerous weaknesses, but his stun was not one. A great Veigar always lands his stun when it matters most, and people find that aggravating. Was it fair? Most definitely; you stepped out of line and got caught, no one dived Veigar, no one built tenacity or magic resist.

It does not change the fact that people hated how it could set up a kill with little to no warning.

I love Veigar, I enjoy playing him, and I am terribly sad to see his stun take a turn for the worse. However, I would be perfectly fine with this if Riot just adjusted him to make up for that loss. With the PBE changes, Veigar is a better farmer... and that's it; his kill potential has been seriously hurt. I fully expect to see buffs, and I would not settle for less.

Thank you for a great comment that actually zeroes in on the problem without being too salty about it. Too long I have seen people just complaining and bitching at Riot without actually explaining the problem. It just doesn't feel productive.

Anyways, I agree, his farming is stronger. I'm on the fence when it comes to more buffs being required, seeing as he tends to get more AP than before. The removal of his stun cast time could be a great place to help him out, and I suspect Riot will do that first before touching his numbers. For me, its a wait and see. He might turn out weaker on live (I feel like, as Veigar, I was getting more farm on PBE than I should have on Live) or not.

I'm a full supporter of the Stunfield change (c'mon guys, anyone with working brains could've figured out that was going to get changed *eventually*), but also a full supporter of OP's idea.

Frankly, many old mages should have their cast times removed on some of their key skills.
I for one don't get the point of the cast time on Viktor's ult. It's like Riot saw that every single one of his spells is delayed and thought "you know what this kit is missing? More delay"

Nami has a delay on every single one of her skills and that's pretty much the only reason she's balanced. I think delays on spells have their place, depending on the skill and the kit as whole. 

For Viktor, I don't really play him, so I can't say for sure. I'm just pointing out there might be a reason for it.

3 of her spells are delayed and that's because of the fact they're cc/utility. There is a huge difference between deadly utility like her Q or ult being delayed and pretty much everything in a mage's kit.
Agreed, the cast times are so large on some abilities that really don't need them.

I so thought you were gonna ask: what about Tibbers?

So, what about Tibbers?  :)

Yeah, every time when I play as Veigar vs Annie I think the same. It is "I stun her or she stun me" fight, except in teamfight if I didn't stop her, she almost wipes out my team, while I can nuke 1 guy. But hey, it is not fair, circle edge is SO DAMN EASIER TO HIT THAN FULL CIRCLE AREA.
Yeah.
hopefully she will be hit with the nerf bat too (add a cast time on her passive, so she doesn't sit on hit for 1/2 min?)
At least you know when her stun is up. There IS such a thing as good Annie's and bad Annie's, you know.

Yeah a good annie will keep her stun up for tibbers a great amounth of time and land it on 3 or more poeple, a bad annie will keep her stun up for tibbers a great amounth of time and land it on 3 or more poeple, but it's not the same :p

My point was, by forcing support annie to use mana for keeping her stun up, you actualy create an opportunity for the ennemy team other than "wait till she decide to use it, even if it take 5 minute"

By letting the passive in this state, if they nerf her because she become a to much powerfull support, it will hurt mid annie too (and we all know support annie is pick for the stun, not for her ratio)

A good Annie will use her stun on only 1 or 2 people if her team can get a pick. A good Annie saves her last two spells, throws her Q then activates shield to hide her stun once the Q reaches its target. A good Annie roams mid (if support) and gets her stun ready on the way so she can snowball her midlane too. A good Annie is intimately familiar with both her flash range and her Tibbers range. A good Annie doesn't get caught out so she can save her Flash for those oh so sweet teamfight Tibbers initiates that you were just talking about. 

I don't like the idea of decaying passive Annie. Its like if Sona's passive decayed. It just makes all the planning and reaction involved with playing Annie go away. Annie doesn't cast one spell to get her stun up, she casts FOUR. Five if you count the spell she must cast to proc the actual stun. 

If you see support Annie walking towards you with her stun, blow her up. She is incredibly squishy and her range is as short as Ryze's (possibly shorter). Gank her lane a lot, make her blow her Flash on escape. She doesn't have peel besides her stun, and she's lucky to get it up twice a fight early game, especially pre-Tibbers. An Annie without Flash is a sad Annie.

Yeah, but a bad Annie will also waste her stun on a minion or completely whiff Tibbers.

But I do see what you mean with the "stun up time" problem.

Annie also has an easy learning curve, but then there is the high amount of skill one can achieve once they've covered the basics of Annie.

Plus, all her skills are shorter ranged than other mages, and she doesn't have any escapes. I think it's a pretty fair exchange, IMO

Tibbers is pretty short range (shorter, I believe, than Veigar's stun range). Its also not in and of itself a stun, Annie has to make sure her passive is up before diving in. Her passive could be blown early, not be ready yet, etc--its something you have to plan for. Combine all of this with the fact that Annie is incredibly squishy and does not have a gapcloser, and you at least have a skill that is usually telegraphed and can be played around. Annie pretty much requires Flash (or a Kalista ult maybe) to get the jump on her opponents. Its also her ult and not just a regular skill she can cast anytime, so it can afford to be a tad stronger than, say, Veigar's stun (one has an 80 second flat CD at rank 3 the other has a 16 second CD at rank 5...shorter currently on PBE)

As a support, Annie performs poorly against the likes of Leona, and can fair bad against Thresh or Blitz because of their superior lane engage and natural tankiness. A decent Braum and/or Caitlyn can also make bot lane hell for her. In mid, Annie is terrible against poke and has to be really careful around assassins because of her short range. Hence why you don't really see Annie mid all that often.

I feel like Annie is one of the few examples of a decently balanced champion. Yeah, her Tibbers can be annoying, it can be a game-changer, but there's also plenty of counter-play against her (squishy, short range, you can see when she has her stun). She's CAN change the game, but she's not a dealbreaker from champ select, especially in solo queue.

The cast time is separate from the actual delay. You select a location, Veigar walks up to it, and then he basically channels for half a second. The new delay on the stun means that now there's the cast time of 0.5 seconds *plus* the 0.75 second delay on the actual stun, totaling at 1.25 seconds until someone actually gets stunned.

This is exactly what the OP wants to prevent from happening.
